definition: to surround/to encircle/to enclose/to fence in
to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: We have our enemy almost surrounded.
sentences.chinese: 我们差不多把敌人包围起来了。

sentences.english: He hedged about his garden with bamboo.
sentences.chinese: 他用竹子把菜园围起来。

sentences.english: The farmer fenced in his garden .
sentences.chinese: 农夫将他的花园用篱笆围起。

sentences.english: The playground has been railed in.
Scarcely had we passed the heads before the land closed around us.
sentences.chinese: 船刚通过两个尖角，立即就被陆地包围起来。

sentences.english: The content introverts' camp closely borders the land of the socially anxious.
sentences.chinese: 内向者的营地将社交焦虑的领地壁垒森严地包围起来。

sentences.english: It's strange. Why is this stone table sealed off?
sentences.chinese: 奇怪。这张石桌怎么被围起来了呀？

sentences.english: They railed in their vegetable garden.
sentences.chinese: 他们用栏杆将他们的菜园围起来。

sentences.english: A fenced area, usually near a stable, used chiefly for grazing horses.
sentences.chinese: 被围起来的地区，通常靠近牲畜厩，主要用来牧马。

sentences.english: He enclosed his garden with a hedge.
sentences.chinese: 他用树篱围起他的花园。
士兵们已经把这两座豪华酒店包围起来。

sentences.english: By surrounding the city our troops achieve a bloodless victory.
sentences.chinese: 我军把城市包围起来，获得兵不血刃的胜利。

sentences.english: The negative space in-between the houses formed a letter.
sentences.chinese: 房子包围起来的空间组成了一个字母。

sentences.english: With any other firmware, it will still be a brick.
sentences.chinese: 如何的之外的固件，那个也还用砖变得围起的事的呢。

sentences.english: They surrounded the yard with a palisade.
sentences.chinese: 他们用篱笆把院子围起来了。

sentences.english: He built fencing to protect his garden.
sentences.chinese: 他围起了篱笆以回护园子。

definition: to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)
Muzha (old spelling: Mucha), suburb to the southeast of Taipei
to build by laying bricks or stones
fence (esp. of bamboo or wood railings)
